message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the respiratory system. The lungs are responsible for the exchange of oxygen (O2) and carbon dioxide (CO2) between the air and the bloodstream. Option (A) is correct because oxygen is taken up by the lungs and delivered to the bloodstream to be carried to the rest of the body. Option (B) is incorrect because the lungs do not directly give oxygen to neighbors. Option (C) is incorrect because the lungs do not give oxygen to the ozone layer. Option (D) is incorrect because the lungs do not give oxygen to the poor, but rather to the body as a whole.

The lungs are responsible for extracting oxygen (O2) from the air we breathe and transferring it into the bloodstream. Option (B) is incorrect because the lungs do not directly give oxygen to the neighbor. Option (C) is incorrect because the lungs do not interact with the ozone layer. Option (D) is unrelated and not supported by any physiological process.
